page.title: 07TATTON PARK
page.content: A THOUSAND ACRES OF NATURAL{PARKLAND DESCRIBED BY REPTON AS " TOO SPLENDID TO BE CALLED INTERESTING AND TOO VAST TO BE DEEMED PICTURESQUE; IT IS ALTOGETHER BEAUTIFUL IN SPITE OF THE GREATNESS".{REPTON PRODUCED A RED BOOK IN I791, THE ROADWAY FOLLOWS HIS PLAN AND THE ORIGINAL{BEECH WALK,}WHICH WAS CONSIDERED TOO FORMAL, STILL EXISTS BUT FEW OF THE 18TH CENTURY TREES REMAIN.CAREFULLY PLANTED TREES AND WOODS,BOTH MATURE AND YOUNGER SPECIMENS CONTRAST WITH THE AREAS OF OPEN WATER AND ROLLING GRASSLAND. { A FORESTERS' WALK}HAS BEEN ROUTED OVER A MILE OF WOODLAND WITH A{LEAFLET TO EXPLAIN ITS DEVELOPMENT. { THE DEER}HAVE A 200 ACRE BREEDING {SANCTUARY.}THERE MAY BE AS MANY AS 700 RED AND FALLOW DEER WHICH ARE CULLED IN AUTUMN AND VENISON IS SOLD THROUGH A COOPERATIVE.
